intro: Monadenium stoloniferum, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It is a low-growing perennial shrub that produces yellow flowers and has a fibrous root system adapted to survive in dry conditions. The plant features stolons, which are horizontal stems that root at the nodes and help in vegetative propagation. Its leaves are usually fleshy and succulent, allowing it to store water efficiently. Monadenium stoloniferum is also known for its ability to thrive in poor soils and withstand high temperatures.
